title: Tutorial 01
text:
Exercise 2 — Write a function
Make double(x) return 2 * x. Keep the function name the same.









Inside the function body, return 2 * x.

title: Tutorial 01
section: Exercise 3 — Create a derived column (with setup)
text:
Exercise 3 — Create a derived column (with setup)
Create df$ratio equal to mpg / hp in mtcars, then preview it.














df$ratio <- df$mpg / df$hp
head(df$ratio)
df$ratio <- df$mpg / df$hp
head(df$ratio)

title: Tutorial 01
text:

viewof add = Inputs.number({ label: "Missing addend", value: 4, step: 1 })

title: Tutorial 01
text:
How to use this page

Edit the code in each exercise and click Run Code.
Click Check Answer for instant feedback.
Use Show hint / Show solution as needed.
Your edits persist in the browser.

title: Tutorial 01
text:
Q1 — Make the sum equal 10
Replace BLANK with a number so the expression evaluates to 10.












Replace the two BLANKS with 2 numbers that add up to 7.




1 + 2 + 3 + 4
1 + 2 + 3 + 4

title: Tutorial 01
text:
Q2 — Write a function
Make double(x) return 2 * x. Keep the function name the same.
Behavior is graded, so x*2 and 2*x are both accepted.

title: Tutorial 01
text:
Edit the code in each exercise, click Run Code, then Check Answer.
“Soft blanks” use a placeholder so you don’t get parse errors.
Grading is behavior-based (no gradethis needed).

title: Tutorial 01
Tutorial 01
section: Q3 — Draw a histogram from cars
text:
Q3 — Draw a histogram from cars
Make a histogram using a numeric column from cars.
Valid: hist(cars$dist), hist(cars$speed), with(cars, hist(speed)), hist(cars[["dist"]]), hist(cars[, "speed"]), hist(cars[, 2]).














hist(cars$dist)
hist(cars$dist)

title: Tutorial 01
section: Q3 — Draw a histogram from cars (type the full call)
text:
Q3 — Draw a histogram from cars (type the full call)
Type exactly one of these and nothing else:
hist(cars$dist) or hist(cars$speed)











hist(cars$dist)
hist(cars$dist)
